meanings.definition: In a petulant manner; showing sudden, impatient irritation or bad temper.
meanings.sent1: She stomped petulantly when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: The child pouted petulantly when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent3: He petulantly refused to eat his vegetables, making a funny face.
meanings.sent4: The cat meowed petulantly at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent5: The student sighed petulantly as the teacher assigned more homework.
